markdownRemark.html:
What is MASE?

MASE stands for Mean Absolute Scaled Error. It is related to MAE, or Mean Absolute Error. It is an error metric typically used to rate machine learning models for Time Series data.

How do I calculate MASE?

To calculate MASE you must first get the MAE of the naive model. The naive model just takes the previous period’s value and uses it as the prediction for the current period. Next, you calculae the MAE for the new model. Finally, divide the MAE for the new model by the MAE for the naive model.

How do I use MASE?

MASE will tell you how well a model performs against the naive model. A score of < 1.0 means the model outperforms the naive model (in terms of MAE). A score of 1.0 means the models perform equally. A score of > 1.0 means the new model underperforms the naive model (again in terms of MAE).
